intro: Gambeya kali, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a tropical tree native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has compound leaves with long, slender leaflets and produces woody pods that contain flat, winged seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Gambeya kali is also valued for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions.
